{"step_by_step_thinking": "Small round cell tumors are a group of highly malignant, undifferentiated neoplasms that primarily affect children and young adults. They are characterized by small, round, relatively undifferentiated cells. Neuroblastoma, Retinoblastoma, and Ewing's sarcoma are all examples of small round cell tumors. Hemangiosarcoma, on the other hand, is a type of cancer that originates in the endothelial cells, which line the blood vessels. It is not considered a small round cell tumor.", "answer_choice": "D. Hemangiosarcoma"}
